result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony Luviano was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Anthony Luviano is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Anthony Luviano was found guilty of Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall not possess any illegal substances.
Defendant shall not possess any drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961.

Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by DOC.
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.
Defendant to prepare a letter of apology to the victim and provide to Agent.
Credit for 1 day, if probation is revoked.
